answers.answer: "Recently (for about a month now) I have been experiencing nausea."Has anything changed during this time - foods you eat, medication/s [new, increased, modified], fasting and postprandial glucose [blood sugar] levels elevated than what you posted? Are you getting proper amounts of sleep?"I have even thrown-up a few times"With all your health issues it would be wise to seek medical advice. Throwing up is not a good sign. Might be worth a 30 min drive into Ft Worth for Baylor Medical Center to see an Gastroenterologist to start with. Good luck

question: I am a 54 yr old female, and have been diagnosed with diabetes since 2009.  I very seldom use insulin to bring my blood sugar down.  Recently (for about a month now) I have been experiencing nausea.  I have even thrown-up a few times.  My blood sugars range between 90 - 160 with a good diet.  I am so sick I don't want to eat.  I have lost about 7 pounds already (I need to loose more) but I don't think this is a healthy way to loose it.  I have had 3/4 of my thyroid removed about two years ago due to calcified nodules.  I have other health issues ie. heart disease (stint placed), back problems (two surgeries), one kidney (removed due to turmor), gall bladder removed, and a hysterectomy (in 98).  I am so tired of going to doctors and wonder if I really need to go again.  Should I?
title: nausea and problems
